conclusion: The acceleration of a particle is given by the slope of the velocity-time graph.
For particle A, the acceleration phase occurs from 0 to 2t0, and the slope of the graph during this phase is (2v0 - 0) / (2t0 - 0) = v0 / t0.
For particle B, the acceleration phase occurs from 0 to 3t0, and the slope of the graph during this phase is (v0 - 0) / (3t0 - 0) = v0 / 3t0.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is (v0 / t0) / (v0 / 3t0) = 3.
